page.title: 16LIFE STYLES RED LION PUB
page.content: The Red Lion public house was first built in the fourteenth century probably about 1380. At the beginning of the nineteenth century, the original building was burnt down and for two years the pub moved to a house 200 yards along the road. In 1830 the Red Lion was re-opened on its present site. The pub grounds occupy about one and three quarters acres altogether. The pub contains a restaurant which is well known locally for the high quality of its food. There is only one small bar which does not allow enough room for traditional pub games, such as darts.The most popular drink is bitter beer which sells for 80p a pint, while the average price of a bottle of wine is four pounds.The landlord employs one bar person and one cleaner, while his wife helps in the kitchen. A lack of main drainage means primitive toilets.
